title: Cucullia lilacina
text:
Cucullia lilacina is a <a href="moth">moth</a> of the family <a href="Noctuidae">Noctuidae</a>. It is found in <a href="Mexico">Mexico</a> and the south-western <a href="United%20States">United States</a>. In the United States, it is found in the mountains of southern <a href="Arizona">Arizona</a>, reaching as far north as the White Mountains in the east and the <a href="Grand%20Canyon">Grand Canyon</a> in the west. It is also present in most of <a href="New%20Mexico">New Mexico</a> and in western <a href="Texas">Texas</a>. In Mexico it has been recorded from the Federal District and <a href="Veracruz">Veracruz</a>. A single female is known from Juan Vinas in central <a href="Costa%20Rica">Costa Rica</a>.
The <a href="wingspan">wingspan</a> is about 42 mm. Adults are on wing from June to October in the United States.
Larvae have been reared on "<a href="Erigeron%20divergens">Erigeron divergens</a>".
